main event: A white, spherical object was observed hovering in the northwest sky of Washington, D.C. before accelerating rapidly and disappearing.
interesting points: The sighting occurred on May 25, 1965, at 11:30 PM.,The object was described as much larger and brighter than the moon.,It lasted for 3-4 seconds and discharged little white fragments.,Two independent observers confirmed the sighting.,The conclusion drawn was that the object was an astronomical phenomenon, specifically a meteor.
witness description: One witness is a 51-year-old male with a background in meteorology, retired from the Navy and worked at the U.S. Naval Observatory.
